page.title: 13Army on the Moor - Heathylee
page.content: The army is a nuisance. They chop trees down which means it is dangerous to jump our horses and ponies when we take them up there for their exercise. There is a nice view and there used to be some jumps but they used them as firewood. They fire guns all night and they let flares off most of the night so the army are a real nuisance. They leave dangerous objects like trip wires and old canes lying around in the heather. Some of them leave canisters and they leave useful things as well. We found a range finder, a full tin of shaving foam and once we even found a tent. We are always finding bits of camouflage. Once we found a full belt of live bullets so we gave them back to the army. They lie all over everywhere.
